Title: âš ï¸ Shin Bet Report Exposes Critical Failures Ahead of Hamasâ€™s Oct...
Description: âš ï¸ Shin Bet Report Exposes Critical Failures Ahead of Hamasâ€™s October 7 Attack âš ï¸The Shin Bet, Israelâ€™s internal security agency, has released a sobering summary of its investigations into the systemic breakdowns that preceded Hamasâ€™s devastating October 7, 2023, assault. The report, compiled through internal reviews by each Shin Bet unit and an external panel of former senior officials and experts, identifies significant shortcomings within the agency while also attributing much of the failure to external factors, including an ambiguous division of duties with the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), a passive government policy toward Gaza, and the agencyâ€™s ill-suited approach to countering a militarized adversary like Hamas.Much of the report remains classified to protect the Shin Betâ€™s sensitive intelligence methods, but the unclassified portions paint a stark picture of an agency caught off guard. The investigation concludes that the Shin Bet failed to issue a warning about Hamasâ€™s large-scale attack, despite receiving indicators on the night of October 6. While a small contingent of elite Shin Bet and police officers was deployed to the Gaza border and engaged in combat, their efforts were insufficient to halt the onslaught.The report outlines a series of professional and managerial lapses that contributed to the intelligence failure. The agency states that these deficiencies have been -thoroughly examined,- with lessons already being implemented. Contrary to assumptions of complacency, the Shin Bet insists it recognized Hamas as a serious threat and sought to neutralize it, though its actions fell short.Key findings reveal why no alert was raised:- Mishandled Intelligence: Hamasâ€™s invasion plans, detailed in an IDF-obtained document dubbed -Jerichoâ€™s Walls,- were not adequately addressed over several years or incorporated into training scenarios.- Jurisdictional Confusion: An unclear delineation of responsibilities between the Shin Bet and IDF left uncertainty over who was accountable for war warnings as Hamas evolved into a full-fledged military force.- Strategic Misalignment: The Shin Betâ€™s focus on thwarting terror attacks was ill-equipped to tackle an enemy operating with army-like capabilities.- Operational Breakdown: On the night of October 6-7, intelligence handling faltered, protocols were bypassed, and coordination with IDF intelligence was lacking.- Oversight Gaps: Weaknesses in intelligence supervision allowed critical lapses to persist.- Misread Priorities: Analysts believed Hamas aimed to escalate tensions in the West Bank, not Gaza.- Overconfidence in Defenses: The agency misjudged the Gaza border barrierâ€™s strength and the IDFâ€™s response capacity.- Unchallenged Assumptions: Hamasâ€™s perceived intentions went largely unquestioned in assessments.- Limited Intelligence: Restricted operational freedom in Gaza hampered the Shin Betâ€™s ability to gather robust data.The report also highlights factors that enabled Hamas to amass strength and execute the attack. Israelâ€™s policy of maintaining calm in Gaza inadvertently allowed Hamas to build its military might. Qatari funds bolstered the groupâ€™s arsenal, while Israelâ€™s deterrence steadily eroded. A reliance on intelligence and defensive measures, rather than proactive strikes, further emboldened Hamas. The decision to launch the assault was fueled by grievances over Israeli actions at the Temple Mount, treatment of Palestinian prisoners, and perceptions of a fractured Israeli society.The Shin Bet acknowledges the gravity of these failures and pledges ongoing reforms. The findings underscore a harsh reality: even a sophisticated security apparatus can falter when confronted with an evolving threat and systemic missteps.WHATSAPP CHANNEL ğŸ”— https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va4EEJU7YSdAqzGs362FTELEGRAM ğŸ”— https://t.me/JewishBreakingNewsTelegramWHATSAPP GROUP ğŸ”— https://chat.whatsapp.com/JMJbkda2SRLCc1ascbYVAU
